title: Technical Program Manager, Enterprise Platform Engineering
description: A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us and we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work.
key_qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of experience in technical program management. 2 years of experience supporting a Salesforce production environment. 2 years of experience in debugging and troubleshooting Salesforce production support issues.
preferred_qualifications: Experience in supporting other third-party applications (e.g., Intellum, Contentstack, and Verint). Experience working with web technologies, API design and development, and back-end systems. Experience coding in Java or Python. Experience in designing, implementing, and testing applications, integrations, and systems.
responsibilities: Support enterprise platforms (both first-party and third-party) through participation in Oncall, complex issues troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and testing. Ensure the success and quality of operational processes by working closely with cross-functional organizational units. Manage various programs involving analysis and availability/efficiency improvements. Drive project delivery, technology reviews, challenge proposals, and build consensus.
